# rvec [![](data-raw/sticker.png)](https://github.com/bayesiandemography/rvec)

Tools for working with random draws, including draws from a simulation
or Bayesian analysis. The main data structure is an `rvec`, which holds
multiple draws but which behaves (mainly) like a standard R vector.

## Installation

``` r
install.packages("rvec")                            ## CRAN version
devtools::install_github("bayesiandemography/rvec") ## development version
```

## Example

``` r
library(rvec, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
```

Create an `rvec`.

``` r
x <- rvec(rbind(c(10, 11),
                c(100, 101),
                c(1000, 1001)))
x
#> <rvec_dbl<2>[3]>
#> [1] 10,11     100,101   1000,1001
```

Perform arithmetic on it.

``` r
x + 1
#> <rvec_dbl<2>[3]>
#> [1] 11,12     101,102   1001,1002
```

Put it in a tibble.

``` r
df <- tibble(g = c(1, 2, 1), x)
df
#> # A tibble: 3 × 2
#>       g         x
#>   <dbl> <rdbl<2>>
#> 1     1     10,11
#> 2     2   100,101
#> 3     1 1000,1001
```

Manipulate it in a tibble.

``` r
df %>%
  group_by(g) %>%
  count(wt = x)
#> # A tibble: 2 × 2
#> # Groups:   g [2]
#>       g         n
#>   <dbl> <rdbl<2>>
#> 1     1 1010,1012
#> 2     2   100,101
```

Summarise it.

``` r
draws_mean(x)
#> [1]   10.5  100.5 1000.5
```

## Other packages for working with random draws

- [rv](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=rv)
- [posterior](https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=posterior)

# Package index

## All functions

- [`as_list_col()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/as_list_col.md)
  : Convert to List Column
- [`collapse_to_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/collapse_to_rvec.md)
  [`expand_from_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/collapse_to_rvec.md)
  : Convert a Data Frame Between 'Database' and 'Rvec' Formats
- [`dbeta_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbeta_rvec.md)
  [`pbeta_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbeta_rvec.md)
  [`qbeta_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbeta_rvec.md)
  [`rbeta_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbeta_rvec.md)
  : The Beta Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dbinom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbinom_rvec.md)
  [`pbinom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbinom_rvec.md)
  [`qbinom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbinom_rvec.md)
  [`rbinom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dbinom_rvec.md)
  : The Binomial Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dcauchy_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dcauchy_rvec.md)
  [`pcauchy_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dcauchy_rvec.md)
  [`qcauchy_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dcauchy_rvec.md)
  [`rcauchy_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dcauchy_rvec.md)
  : The Cauchy Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dchisq_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dchisq_rvec.md)
  [`pchisq_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dchisq_rvec.md)
  [`qchisq_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dchisq_rvec.md)
  [`rchisq_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dchisq_rvec.md)
  : The Chi-Squared Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dexp_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dexp_rvec.md)
  [`pexp_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dexp_rvec.md)

  : The Exponential Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`df_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/df_rvec.md)
  [`pf_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/df_rvec.md)

  : The F Distribution, Using Multiple Draws

  [`pgamma_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dgamma_rvec.md)
  [`qgamma_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dgamma_rvec.md)

  : The Gamma Distribution, Using Multiple Draws

  [`pgeom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dgeom_rvec.md)
  [`qgeom_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dgeom_rvec.md)

  : The Geometric Distribution, Using Multiple Draws

  [`phyper_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dhyper_rvec.md)

  : Divorce Rates in New Zealand

  : Logical Operations Across Random Draws

  : Credible Intervals from Random Draws
- [`draws_fun()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/draws_fun.md)
  : Apply Summary Function Across Random Draws
- [`draws_median()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/draws_median.md)
  [`draws_mean()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/draws_median.md)

  : Medians, Means, and Modes Across Random Draws

  [`draws_max()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/draws_min.md)
  : Minima and Maxima Across Random Draws
- [`draws_quantile()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/draws_quantile.md)
  : Quantiles Across Random Draws
- [`dt_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dt_rvec.md)
  [`pt_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dt_rvec.md)
  [`qt_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dt_rvec.md)

  : Student t Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dunif_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dunif_rvec.md)
  [`punif_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dunif_rvec.md)

  : Uniform Distribution, Using Multiple Draws
- [`dweibull_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/dweibull_rvec.md)

  : Extract a Single Draw From an Rvec
- [`if_else_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/if_else_rvec.md)
  : Vectorised If-Else, When Condition is an Rvec
- [`is_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/is_rvec.md)
  : Is an Object an Rvec
- [`map_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/map_rvec.md)
  : Apply a Function and Put Results in an Rvec
- [`matrixOps(`*`<rvec>`*`)`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/matrixOps.rvec.md)
  : Matrix Multiplication with Rvecs

  : Missing, Finite, and Infinite Values in Rvecs
- [`n_draw()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/n_draw.md)
  : Query Number of Draws
- [`new_rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/new_rvec.md)
  : Create a Blank Rvec
- [`prob()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/prob.md)
  : Calculate Probabilities from Random Draws
- [`rank()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rank.md)
  : Sample Ranks, Including Rvecs
- [`reg_post`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/reg_post.md)
  : Posterior Sample from Linear Regression
- [`rvec-package`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec-package.md)
  : Package 'rvec'
- [`rvec()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec.md)
  [`rvec_chr()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec.md)
  [`rvec_dbl()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec.md)
  [`rvec_int()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec.md)
  [`rvec_lgl()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/rvec.md)
  : Create an Rvec from Data
- [`sd()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/sd.md) :
  Standard Deviation, Including Rvecs
- [`var()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/var.md)
  : Correlation, Variance and Covariance (Matrices), Including Rvecs
- [`weighted_mean()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/weighted_mean.md)
  [`weighted_mad()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/weighted_mean.md)
  [`weighted_median()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/weighted_mean.md)

  [`weighted_var()`](https://bayesiandemography.github.io/rvec/reference/weighted_mean.md)
  : Calculate Weighted Summaries

### All vignettes
